Reviews.Title: “Good boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deally
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant Hotel - friendly staff and great location.Nice to not have to walk a mile to my room

Reviews.Title: “A grand hotel on an intimate scale!”
Reviews.Author: lkoxford
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step into this historic boutique hotel (it was originally the first Hilton hotel named for Conrad Hilton), the attention to quality and detail is evident. The architecture and decor are very reminiscent of the South's grand hotels, but on a much more intimate scale. The reception area is beautifully appointed and tastefully decorated, with an excellent restaurant and a comfortable club room and business center just off the lobby. I arrived two hours before the 3:00 PM check-in time, and was immediately shown to a beautifully decorated bedroom with all the amenities one would expect in a luxury hotel. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, the sitting area inviting, and the hotel very quiet. On Wednesday evenings, complimentary hot and cold appetizers, sweets and drinks are served in the club room, and offer an opportunity for mid-week refreshment and relaxation with live music. The staff members are friendly, helpful and responsive to every need, and free shuttle service is available within a 3-mile radius of the hotel. There is a small public garden and park across the street, and several excellent restaurants are within easy walking distance. The hotel is also easily accessible via public transportation - I took the DART to and from the airport (Love Field) for a total of $3.50. It's an elegant gem of a hotel in the heart of Dallas that you'll be very glad you discovered.

Reviews.Title: “March 30 and 31st Stay”
Reviews.Author: Regina R
Reviews.Content: My daugher was married on March 31, 2012 at the Room on Main venue in downtown Dallas, Texas. We stayed at the Hotel Indigo in downtown Dallas since only about 3/4 block away from the venue. We had a fantastic stay! They delivered all my goody bags to my guest, transported us Friday night to reherasal dinner (about 3 blocks away) and made several trips to the venue all day Saturday. They allowed the bride and bridesmaid to check into their rooms at 11 am (instead of 3 pm) on Saturday so that they could start getting hair and make up ready. I could go on but just note outstanding service all around.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MauiPigFarmer
Reviews.Content: As always the greeters and lobby staff make you feel welcome and will assist you in any way. Good place to stay for a downtown trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for solo business travelers - maybe not for couples”
Reviews.Author: RiverCityMan
Reviews.Content: Trendy boutique-ish hotel with bright, colorful, funky decor, located in restored space in an older building in downtown Dallas. Very clean hotel, friendly and courteous staff. The beds were comfy and I slept like a happy, quiet, dead log every night. The hotel room that I had (2 queens) had almost no available floor space (see photo with review - sorry no natural light, daylight makes the room look MUCH brighter and cheerier) and the TV in the room was smaller than the monitor that I have on my desk - otherwise the room and furnishings were clean and everything worked properly. Interesting thing to note: there was no furniture in the room with drawers to store anything, and there wasn't any kind of rack to stow a suitcase. Closet space was provided in the bathroom with ample hangers so it really wan't an issue for me since I was flying solo on this trip. I would absolutely stay here again if traveling by myself. The combo of limited floor space and no storage makes me question how great it would be with 2 people in the room for a week. I can just see my wife and I bumping into each other like 2 of the 3 stooges (assuming all the rooms are similar)! Decent location: I walked to my business destination down in the Museum District in about 15 minutes each day. The hotel also provides a free shuttle that will drop off / pick up in a 3 mile radius. If you walk to/from this hotel to/from the west end, use Elm and avoid Pacific. Restaurant: Indigo has a dining area on the ground floor. By 7am each day they were pretty packed so get there at 6:30 when they open. On check-in I received coupons for breakfast and for a free drink at the bar each night (bonus!). Hot breakfast options were simple but very good for complimentary fare: eggs/bacon/potatoes/toast, pancakes, oatmeal, etc. The service seems to take a little while to make it's way around. After the first day when no one came back to fill up water glasses and coffee (30 minutes in the restaurant), the next day I simply asked for 2 glasses of water the first time I saw the wait staff and it was fine. The gym was very small and limited, however - for $5 per day, I highly recommend that you simply take a 2 minute walk over the 2nd floor sky bridge to the Elevation gym and get yourself a day pass. Excellent gym: open 5am-9pm, free weights, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Party and Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sohuggeidy
Reviews.Content: For my birthday party I made a reservation at Hotel Indigo for a King Suite hoping to find a place to celebrate my birthday. It was hard to find a place in Downtown Dallas that wouldn't required a minimum amount of less than 1500; I didn't have a big budget for my party so as a last resort I sent an email to the special events coordinator explaining the situation. She came back to me saying that they could work with my budget and set up a beautiful party for me. My friends and I had a blast! Now to the stay part. The King Suite was excellent, the furniture and decorations were very tasteful, everything was clean and perfect; all the staff was helpful and friendly recommended a few places we could go for the after party. The location and price of the hotel is the best for downtown Dallas, a lot of the people on my party have recommended this hotel to their co-workers that need to stay near the downtown area for business. Valet parking is 20.00 per night but there isn't really a need for valet since there is a parking garage right across street that costs 4.00 or 12.00 for overnight stay. Free Wi-Fi (this is important for me)

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: skychels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Indigo in October 2011 whilst travelling though America for a month. It was by far the best hotel I stayed at. The rooms were spotless, staff friendly and it's in a great location. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Katherine D
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Dallas. I have stayed at several hotels, but on my last trip I found the hotel of my dreams, so to speak. From the front desk greeting I received, to the restaurant staff, to room service and last, but certainly not least, from the General Manager. I have been catered to and made to feel like this hotel is my home away from home. They had a wonderful mixer for hotel guests and the food was outstanding; there was live music and everyone was chilling and relaxing! The room was ultra clean, the bed was comfortable, and the staff, every single member of the staff, was ready to help in anyway possible. I will be staying at this hotel every two weeks throughout the rest of this year, and am so glad to find a "home away from home". Believe me! I am picky and I could not find one negative. Stay at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Indigo is a GO!”
Reviews.Author: kidztrvl2
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week. Spring Break 3-12 thru 3-16. The room was clean, beds very comfy, a/c was quiet, staff was very professional, valet parking quick & easy, breakfast & happy hour was excellent. Would highly recommend and we would stay here again. From some very picky travelers!!! The blue and yellow decor was very cheerful and enjoyable. The rooms and bath are smaller compared to newer hotels, but the charm of the building and the convenience of being downtown Dallas is a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “A great location!”
Reviews.Author: Txlori
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Hotel Indigo. The location is great. We were able to walk to several museums and restaurants. The hotel was nicely decorated The beds were comfortable and the staff very helpful. The only negative was the size of the bathroom. We would definitely stay at Hotel Indigo again!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: LAVALAV
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in March. I was so disappointed in the cleanliness of the room: The light-switches were caked with grime, which came right off when I wiped with soap and water. There was a coffee cup with a crust of yellowish residue left near the coffee maker. The walls of the bathroom were dusted with sticky hairs from dozens of men shaving, and even the ceiling of the shower had hairs stuck to it. The mirror on the bathroom door was covered with smudges. The duvet bedding also had hairs of varying lengths from previous guests. There is nothing more unfriendly and depressing than a hotel room that is littered with organic material from prior occupants. I agree with some of the other comments that the walls are quite thin - I turned on the fan in the room to drown out the sound of TV and chatter from the adjacent room. The heat and cooling system was very good and it's nice to have wood floors. The towels were okay and the Aveda bath products were nice. They gave me three drink tickets and three coupons for $15 breakfast. I used the coupons to stock up on beverages in the morning and they also have a hot breakfast menu to order from. There was a manager's reception on Weds night with hors d'oevres, wine, beer, and soft drinks. There are several restaurants around the area, a 7-11, and Neiman Marcus is close by. This hotel has a lot of potential but they need to get the rooms clean. That is the foundation of any hotel property. I would rather stay in a clean room at Motel 6 than a filthy suite at the Ritz. I probably will not stay here again - next time I will stay at the Fairmont (which is very nice) or try the Magnolia.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and quaint!”
Reviews.Author: Ekermit
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king suite for our first getaway after having our daughter. The staff was very helpful at check in and at the valet stand. The room was comfortable, clean and the decor was very chic. The cable is mediocre with not all the local channels (kdfi) and no Fox Sports SW which meant we couldn't watch the Mavs game. WiFi service was good and didn't seem to run slow or sluggish. The Indigo isn't somewhere I'd stay for a romantic getaway but for someone wanting to stay downtown it's close enough to the West End and Uptown to offer a variety of options for nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: Hniki234
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Indigo once before in a suite and loved it! This time, I booked a regular double room and was pretty disappointed. First, we arrived on Friday night and had trouble valeting our car. The guy didn't seem to be in a hurry even though there were 3 cars in line for valet (we were car #3). Since we were checking in, we were told to wait for valet rather than handing off our keys at the front desk. We sat outside and waited our turn only to have the valet guy pass us up and go inside where he took the keys of the guy in line behind us. The valet staff on Saturday and Sunday were MUCH better (and professionally dressed while the valet guy on Friday night was not). My second complaint is that, on our first night, we received a phone call from the front desk stating that they had received a noise complaint on us. This was disturbing because we were honestly just sitting in our room discussing our plans for the next day. No TV, no radio. Just talking...without any laughter. We were informed that the walls were very thin. Later, we realized just how thin they were as we could hear entire conversations taking place in the hall. My last issue with this stay was the toilet. Every time it was flushed, it made a high pitched squealing noise. Other than those issues, the hotel is bright and cheerful. Beds are reasonably comfortable. Shower pressure is great. And they have a nice casual restaurant in the lobby. While I loved it after my first stay, this second stay will probably keep me from going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the disappointments.”
Reviews.Author: Tgonzales12
Reviews.Content: We bought a Groupon and stayed last night. Apparently they don't like those guests, because the valet and cafe attemdant were the only friendly or helpful staff we encountered. I got a call the morning of our stay letting me know that even though the deal reserved a King Suite, and I booked a month in advance, they gave all those rooms to stay-overs. She offered that I could change my reservation date or take a queen suite, so we did. The rooms were nice, but the bedroom area so small you have to shuffle between the bed and dresser to get to the other side. Comfortable bed though. They offered strawberries and champagne for the inconvenience of the room change, then were so late on the promised delivery time that we had to leave without them. I asked the front desk for a food recommendation for after the hockey game we were in town for, and she pulled out a large unorganized file box and told me to go through it and call places to see when they closed. Our room keys stopped working and we had to go downstairs for new ones- twice. They never apologized for a single issue. I wish I had paid full price for any other hotel, than spent my trip disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable, great beds, be ready to hear your neighbors!”
Reviews.Author: chrysb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adorable!! My daughter & I went to Dallas the end of February for the NCA Cheer competition (1st place by the way;D). Our room, we had an end room so it is long & skinny with a bed on each end. Cool set up. Adorable decor. The beds are VERY comfy!! Pillows too! The bathrooms are fine. All very clean. Everything we needed. The walls, well, we could actually hear the conversations our neighbors had, normal conversations, not yelling! Paper thin walls. Gaps around all the doors so the light & noise comes in there too. I had to stuff a towel in the cracks because the hall light came in all around the door & lit up one of the beds. I tried to keep the fan on on the heating/cooling system all night, but it wouldn't work that way. Fortunately, the noise stopped around midnight on our floor, so we could sleep after that :D. Well, we were on the 13th floor & the road traffic was pretty loud too. I remember different vehicles waking us up now that I think about it. I had never been Dallas, TX so I didn't want to worry with a car & getting lost. The free shuttle here is great, they take you anywhere w/in 3 miles & they give you a card & you call them & they come pick you up & bring you back. This was awesome! My longest wait was 10 minutes. There are a few restaurants easy to walk to. The lobby bar is a restaurant too. Kind of expensive - but convenient & cute. We ate breakfast there every morning including when rushing out to catch a plane, they hurried to make some eggs for us. Very nice! Adorable area - pleasant to sit in. They have a computer & printer in the lobby you can use to print your boarding passes or schedules. That was nice. They do have wifi but I didn't find that it worked well. Other than the walls being so thin, this was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stepping above and beyond for customer service!”
Reviews.Author: TeaseChef
Reviews.Content: During my stay I had a wonderful encounter with Meme when I checked in she provided me with a take out menu when I explained I was starving. She made sure I was all set for my stay. After I checked out of the hotel I grabbed the complementary shuttle to take for my interview. During the ride the gentleman named Franklin gave me his card and told me if I needed a taxi after he would be glad to get me one. I called him after the interview and sure enough he got me the taxi. To top it off he called to make sure I was in the taxi and I was being taken care of. That is what I call stepping above and beyond the call of customer service. Thanks again to everyone who made my trip amazing!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else but here.”
Reviews.Author: Melissa C
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for work and the service at this hotel is exceptional. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are awesome! The server/bartender was very enthusiastic, friendly, knowledgeable, and provided me and the others I observed with stellar service. It was nice to have this kind of service after a long day of work and travel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo Dallas - Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: Wayne M
Reviews.Content: I have spent the last 4 weeks at the Hotel Indigo in Dallas. I love this hotel. The staff and management are great. They always make you feel welcomed and at home. The rooms are comfortable and give you the feeling of being in a cottage. everything about this hotel is great. I travel to Dallas a lot and will always stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Once again- we love Indigo!”
Reviews.Author: LaSooner
Reviews.Content: Beds are sooooo comfortable. Room service was excellent. Every employee- from the shuttle driver to the front desk to housekeeping to room service were so nice and so helpful. Shuttle is an awesome bonus. Anywhere within a 3 mile radius. We walked to a ton of places just down the street and had a great time. Will continue to recommend to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to stay in bed all day!”
Reviews.Author: DLLH
Reviews.Content: I have to laugh at myself when I say that I could have stayed in bed all day! So heavenly cozy! And lots of pillows! My husband and I stayed at the indigo prior to flying out to Cancun. From the moment we walked in the door we were greeted by beautifully colored walls and decor. The yellow put me in a great mood. Staff is polite and valet had our car ready quickly. I agree with most reviews on here on the dynamics of this historical hotel. Our room was clean cozy and warm. I loved the yellow bedroom decor in room 513. I was thrilled to find out that we were close and to the JFK memorial and museum. We spent time there. Sometimes I believe people need to come back to the beauty of history and relax...Indigo is that place. Thanks to all the kind staff for making our first visit one to remember! I definitely will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: mtspazzo1204
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 nights at this Indigo location. This is my third visit to this hotel and I have no complaints. It is conveniently located to Downtown and restaurants, it is clean, and the beds are comfortable. I couldn't really ask for much more, but the staff is the bonus here. Everyone was exceptionally nice and helpful. I would like to extend my gratitude to the shuttle staff who drove me to and from my seminar each day. I actually looked forward to seeing Franklin's smiling face each morning, he got my day going on such a positive note. Thank you everyone for making my weeklong stay so great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a week long stay”
Reviews.Author: StephandJohn32244
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a business trip that was booked through a travel agent. I typically like newer properties and this was not one of them. According to a plaque in the lobby, this was the first hotel built by Conrad Hilton in...let's just say a long time ago. The staff is very friendly and helpful. My room (#1013) was right across from the elevator which worried me some as I didn't want to hear the noise all night long. Upon entering the room, I found that it was a suite. The living room area was actually quite large with a sofa and a love seat. A desk was against the far wall. Behind the door was a microwave and a sall refrigerator. The room was capped off with a flat screen TV and a wall of windows. There is nothing to the view from this room as you look out at other rooms. The entire unit has hardwood floors which was actually a nice touch. The bedroom is spacious with another flat screen TV. The clothes closet is in the bathroom along with an ironing board and several wood hangers. The shower and toilet is in a separate room. The shower has a removable handheld head. The shampoo, conditioner, and lotion are all Aveda. The bed is amazingly comfortable along with the bevy of great pillows. There were many mornings that I just wanted to stay in the bed. So much for the good, here's a few negatives. The noise from the elevator and noise in the hallway is very loud if you are in the living room. If you are in the bedroom with the door closed, the noise isn't noticeable. The A/C is digitally controlled by the panel in the bedroom. However, it is a little loud when it kicks on. It is also mounted in the roof above the shower. The shower had a strong sour smell the first three days I was there and the shower floor had a slimy feel every day. I can only hope that it was drainage from the A/C unit which had an open pipe right above the shower. You can tell that the building is old. All you have to do is look at the trim which is beat up and has been horribly painted over. The lobby is a comfortable place to relax. The Phi restaurant is also in the lobby along with a bar. However, the drink prices are very steep with a bottle of beer running $7 which is almost as much as an entree. The hotel is within walking distance of several restaurants on Main and Elm Streets. Many residents in the area take their dogs to the dog park which is directly across the street. The shuttle will take guests anywhere within a 3-mile radius which includes a Walmart and a Target store. The bellmen were great as was the shuttle driver. The bellmen typically have the shuttle and transportation services on speed dial to get them there quicker. I would stay here again if I was doing business in downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Simply gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Conejito2011
Reviews.Content: First time I stayed here and I fell in love with the Hotel Indigo. The vibrant colors... the soft beds.. the new designs with historical character and delicious food as well. The staff were professional, polite and accurate when giving me directions and information. Parking became a hassle because I was not aware of the cost or the rules; I found out that since I was a state employee that my valet was free, at least back in Feb 2010 but I don't know about now since I hear management has now changed everything. At any rate... I continue to travel and thank all the hotels who are willing to accommodate me as I travel for the university in Texas that I work for. I tell all my travel colleagues and friends about what places to stay and where not to spend your money on. Thanks again =)

Reviews.Title: “Dallas or Downtown Detroit ?”
Reviews.Author: Roadhemi
Reviews.Content: Oil is over $100 a barrel right ? Dallas is an oil city right ? Why am I tripping over nasty homeless people at the doorway ? Why is this hotel located in what seems to be a post-nuclear warzone? Why did my secretary book me in here ? Nice front desk staff, but what a joke of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: My love for boutique hotels started when I wondered into this little gem of a hotel for dinner before a show. I finally got to stay here years later, this past November. We were in town for NASCAR weekend but wanted to stay somewhere away from all the hoopla! We had a suite on the top floor that was too cute - blue, yellow and polka dots! Loved it! The hotel is small, but the people are so nice and friendly! I left my shoes here and they shipped them back to me = so very thankful! The little bar area is quite charming - a little pricey but good for a drink before you go out for the evening! I will definately be back next time we are in town!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service / poorly designed hotel / low quality bed”
Reviews.Author: PJL60654
Reviews.Content: (My opinion obviously:) Hotel Indigos are inherently poorly designed; the nautical/country theme frankly doesn't work for me. The bedding is of a 1-2 star hotel quality - not 3-3.5 star. Sheratons, Marriotts, Hiltons and Hyatts have MUCH better beds. The Indigo did not have a down comforter but rather poor quality sheets and pillows, and a bedspread - not what I'd expect these days from a 3+ star hotel. I realize it sounds picky - but if you're used to a bed at a 3+ star hotel, this doesn't cut it. I'm a bit surprised that a fairly major chain would choose such haphazard design and poor materials. In addition, here's the deal with the cleaning (I stayed 2 nights); I had a note under my door that housekeeping tried to stop by around 9am, but I was still in the room with the do not disturb sign on. It said that if I wanted my room cleaned, to notify the front desk. All well and good. I did so when I left around 10:20am (notified the front desk I'd like my room made up). When I returned around 2:30, the room hadn't yet been cleaned, so when I left again around 3pm, I asked again to make sure my room was on the list to be cleaned. I was told by a different person that it would surely be done. When I returned again around 5:45pm, it was not yet cleaned. I left at 6:15pm and told that same person again that it hadn't been cleaned, and that I was leaving for a few hours and they assured me it would be cleaned. I returned about 11:15pm and it was not cleaned. I told another front desk person who finally sent up new towels and toiletries, and also took my phone # (I mistakenly assumed I might get a call from the manager because of this); I left the hotel at 4:30am the next morning to catch a flight - and have not heard from anyone. I realize I could have conserved towels and soap and shampoo, but again, at a 3.5 star rated hotel, I just expect that my room will be made up, new towels put in place, and frankly even when mistakes are made, a bit of responsiveness from hotel staff (THREE different people!)

Reviews.Title: “Don't recommend”
Reviews.Author: NormanClan
Reviews.Content: I stay here due to price and convenient location but the hotel is mediocre at best. It has new paint but the lack of cleanliness leaves you quesitoning your decision to stay here. In addition, the menu for room service is lack luster. I highly recommend paying a bit more and stay at the Adolphus or the new OMNI.

Reviews.Title: “I would like to check in please.”
Reviews.Author: Paolo P
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the hotel was not awe inspiring, but it was nice enough. That wing said, I tried and was turned away three time for check in. The tell me check in is t until 3:00 (this is at 2:50) I say okay. I go back at 3:00 and they say no I'm sorry check in begins at 3 so it will be anothe 30 to 45 min. I try again at 330 and no still not ready. When it is time to pay it is up front and to the right, but apparently when you has paid and they no longer feel it nessesery it is at their leisure. This is unexceptable. The bar tender was nice durning the wait.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a gem”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan B
Reviews.Content: While the outside of the hotel is a bit bland, the inside is very nicely decorated and furnished. Reception staff is attentive and keen to help. The complimentary shuttle is a great help in getting to various tourist sites and the drivers are helpful with advice and suggestions, particularly Franklin. Breakfast was excellent with a good range of choices and thoughtful service. Our bedroom was fine with a good sized shower room (no shower gel, but various lotions and conditioners) and very soft towels. This hotel was a very nice experience during the four nights we stayed in mid November.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, surprisingly great priced too.”
Reviews.Author: awoodby
Reviews.Content: This hotel has obviously been recently completely renovated and redecorated, everything new and sharp. The location is right downtown, staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are large, with a living room and very comfortable bed. Really nothing but good to say.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly priced excellent hotel with a heavenly bed.”
Reviews.Author: RandomPixels
Reviews.Content: $100 got us a plush queen size bed, side room with couch, tv and chairs, microwave, fridge and coffee maker. Great shower, free shuttle to/from area activities and very friendly staff. Aveda soap products! Room service was timely and the food was great. Nice attention to detail in the sunny day decore throughout the hotel. High quality furnishings and accessories.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot for JFK-visitors to Dallas”
Reviews.Author: BelgiumItalialover
Reviews.Content: For anyone coming to Dallas in honour of JFK, this is the hotel to be. A few yards from the spot where they killed Oswald, a mile away from Dealey Plaza. On top of the location : (1) excellent value, (2) very friendly staff, (3) best of Dallas-center ( Marcus Neieman Marcus, great restaurants) around the corner. Small minus point : bath/shower without protection handle.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Feel to the Rooms”
Reviews.Author: edra45
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel two times, and enjoyed it both times. However, the first visit was much nicer, as there was a few problems with housekeeping and noise the second visit. The hotel has a spa feel to it and is located near good resturants. The hotel is bright and sunny, like a day at the beach. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Emily K
Reviews.Content: Since this is the original Dallas Hilton, I thought they might preserve a bit of the historical integrity. Not so. The decor is very dated (i.e. perfect for a high school girl's room 20 years ago) and paint is chipped and peeling. The room was VERY small (thank goodness it was just me) and while I understand that it is downtown, it was extremely loud. Aside from the bus traffic and a protest going on outside, there were odd noises going on at all hours. I asked to change rooms due to the noise and was denied. Although I had to wait quite a while for an attendant to even show up to take my car when I arrived, after that, I dealt with the valet supervisor, who was extremely helpful and friendly. By the way, he was the only helpful and/or friendly person working at this establishment. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: warren p
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful staff for the most part. They did get our room ready early for us. 2nd visit here but a few issues to note. Parking should be free or at least be charged a set daily maximum price and not charged for leaving and returning. On two occasions this stay staff knocked very lightly on the door, waited about 2 seconds, and tried to enter the room. The inside lock was in place or there could have been an unintended scene. Staff ignored the "do not disturb" on the door and tried to enter at 8:30am. Room internet did not work.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, get a room above the 3rd floor”
Reviews.Author: brucejkirch
Reviews.Content: the location of hotel indigo is perfect for enjoying downtown dallas. the room i had was nice, a bit smail, but, try to stay above the 3rd floor. I was "underground, " my windows did not look out at anything. I missed the natural sunlight. The staff is great here, and the breakfast is good. The Indgo is walking distance to some great resturants and a mile from Deep ellum and North Dallas. If you are working at the Dallas trade mart, however, you will need a taxi , as it is five miles away, and the hotel only travels a 5 mile radius

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cando2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on a stop-over. The staff are VERY friendly & helpful. They will do anything for you. Courtesy shuttle to take you within a 3 mile radius of the hotel. Free wifi, computers in lobby lounge. Lovely lounge in lobby which was handy when u have a late flight - comfy chairs, computers, tv, wifi. Will also store bags after check-out. Can't say enough about the lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MamaEducator
Reviews.Content: I loved the colors and decor! Very pleasant. The staff was neutral, not rude or overly friendly. The location was great. Directly across the street is a lovely park, busy with locals, water fountain, playground, nice benches, dog area. The parking was good. There are details that don't get cleaned in the bathroom, like the light switches, but the surfaces were clean. If you have children, you might ask about a bathtub, as our room only had a shower. The room was lovely, nice laminate flooring instead of the filthy carpet in most places, we will stay again when needed!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable clean and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: CyndiI
Reviews.Content: The Indigo in downtown Dallas is an oasis of calm with heavy doses of Zen saying to add to the overall effect. I love going to an out of the ordinary place and this location has excellent service from the valet, and front desk to the bell hop and housekeeper. Everyone was friendly and over-the-top helpful. I look forward to staying their again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel & great service!”
Reviews.Author: Christina J
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved how unique the hotel was furnished from the entrance to the rooms. It is like a boutique style hotel. Colors were vibrant & not boring. We had a large group come out for a huge convention and booking group reservations was a breeze! The food at the restaurant was very hearty and good and the servers were very nice. Overall, our experience there was fantastic! The entire staff was welcoming and friendly. We appreciated the complimentary shuttle within a 3 mile radius and it was a great location since many places we needed to go to were either 1 mile away or less so we could even walk if we chose. Looking forward to staying here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: travel4workAA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times, but not in about a year. The staff is what makes this downtown hotel great. Devon at the restaurant and bar is a gem. The rooms are always clean and wonderfully decorated for relaxation. Ask for an upgrade to a suite, they are huge.

Reviews.Title: “Great vibe, good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: thptrek
Reviews.Content: Hotel decor was very nice. The colors are more like a Caribbean resort than downtown Dallas. Front desk and valet service was very good. Bar and restaurant service was mixed. Bar service was especially slow and didn't seem like he knew what he was doing. Room was nice size and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the colors”
Reviews.Author: NJTTexas
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - rooms were big enough (had three to the room). The bathroom was small, but well equipped. One thing which would have been helpful to know that the hotel entrance faces Harwood street and the parking garage is directly across. There is a above street covered walkway to the second floor of the building which is much more convenient than lugging your bags across to the hotel entrance. Check in first so you'll have your "key' to enter from that level. There is a valet to park your car, but nowhere to stop to unload. Better to park yourself and get your bags(if you have a lot of them) later to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Alternative”
Reviews.Author: grover1959
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Indigo for four nights and would probably stay there again. It is a smaller boutique hotel on Main Street downtown. The front desk service was very good, always attentive, cheerful. I had a small two room suite. I thought there was a little too much furniture crammed into the space but it was comfortable. Sitting room with a full size couch, coffee table fridg, microwave, Both rooms have wall mounted TVs. Free internet which I appreciate. The bed was comfortable although I don't think the sheets were changed each day? I had to request wash cloths one day and they brought me enough towels to last a week. Service in the restaurant was slow. I am up and out very early so the earliest they serve coffee and breakfast is 6:30 - a bit late for me. I walked out of the restaurant two mornings because the service was so slow just to take my order. Other than that, no complaints. I liked the overall feel of the hotel, found my suite comfortable, clean and quiet. Room service was much better, meals are pretty standard hotel fare, nothing to get excited about but when you are too tired to go out, it is fine. For the value I was pleased and would likey stay there again if I needed to be downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy510
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this week and this place was a nice change from the usual big box hotels. Very unique and decorated. It was quiet which was nice as well. When I got to my room, the a/c was already on which was great in kkeeping my room cool. I beleive I got a suite as I had a living room and a bedroom. It was alittle tight in the living room because I think they just had large furniture in the room (sofa, coffee table, and desk). I think they could have made it feel better by moving the desk to the other side of the wall and moving the tv to the other wall. It just felt small. The bedroom was arranged nicely and the bathroom was tiny but quaint. Overall, a good stay for what I needed to do in Dallas. I only had 2 issues - 1) The water pressure in the shower was blah! I wished it was stronger. 2) They only give you 1 soap, so if you was your hands at the sink and later take a shower, you will have to walk back to the sink and grab the soap. Not sure why they couldn't put one soap at the sink and in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel In Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Jim D
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights while attending a conference in downtown Dallas and the Hotel Indigo was excellent. The Front Desk personnel were very friendly at check-in and upgraded my to a suite (on the top floor as I requested). The suite was very nice and spacious. Quenn bed in the bedroom and two comfortable sofas in the quite area. The room had a great view and was very clean and comfortable. I also loved the decor. The only negative for Hotel Indigo is that television reception (especially for local channels was very poor).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hotel Indigo Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Texas"Red"
Reviews.Content: My crew and I were there on business during the month of July. We were on a promotional tour for Dole the fruit company. The manager was very helpful let us have an extremely late check out allowing for us to shower etc after our event. Mike Owen the GM even got involved with our promotion by allowing us to give him some product and gift bags which he passed out to his guest upon check in. Great place. It is an all around example of how Hotels and Motels around the world should be. Jim "Red" & Judy Corbett

Reviews.Title: “Cute place...”
Reviews.Author: whatsup814
Reviews.Content: Cute little place....front desk was nice and very helpful. The only thing that stood out was the out dated TV's but the suite had a flat screen.

Reviews.Title: “Girls night out”
Reviews.Author: dodietbrown
Reviews.Content: The staff was great and very accommodating. Check in was a breeze. Shuttle service is a great perk as we didn't have to drive! The room was spacious on the 14th floor with a great view of Dallas and the bed was so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great stay and great time”
Reviews.Author: Granch
Reviews.Content: i've stayed here before and just like last time, great great great. perfect location to where i was going. deep ellum. staff was super nice. room really nice. didn't eat this time at the restaurant but last time i stayed the food was great too. they had a shuttle bus that dropped me off. so every thing was convenient and easy for me. can't wait for the time.

Reviews.Title: “Classic architecture outside, quirky modern inside!”
Reviews.Author: Ngunnawally
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Indigo Dallas Downtown on the last days of a holiday to the US, and was really happy I did. The establishment is modern, cheerful, and near enough to the centre of the Dallas downtown area. All staff I encountered were friendly, attentive and helpful, while my apartment was well appointed. Very comfortable bed, quiet room, fantastic shower, LCD TVs in both rooms, and lavish (yet somehow calming) blueberry wallpaper behind the bed somehow added a nice touch. Complementary wi-fi came in very handy too! All in all, a very nice way to end a holiday in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: aeswhiz
Reviews.Content: Can't speak for the other floors but the 8th floor had lovely murals, clouds painted on the ceiling in at least one place, then my room was yellow, white, and muted royal blue -- so cheerful! All very clean and modern, and a nice place to stay. If driving, call the hotel for directions as MapQuest directs you to the side of the hotel, not the front. There are a lot of one-way streets around there, so recovering can take a bit of time.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: sbalch
Reviews.Content: Booked on the hotel site for $153/night. Room was clean and big, even for a double. Bathroom had no tub and the shower was mediocre with fluctuating hot water (warm to very hot). Also, shower did not drain on the first night, but fixed quickly. Closet is inside the bathroom and not convenient. Desk chair was an old style rollback chair, but not practical and not high enough with a big pillow. Had a room on the 11th floor. Very quiet. Room service menu leaves a bit to be desire, but LOTS of good spots within 500 yards of hotel. Great wifi. Staff was VERY nice!! The microwave and frig are nice touch as well. AC was adequate, but at 105 degrees outside its hard to get cold. Bed and pillows were very comfortable! Little things matter. Blow dryer was less powerful than blowing a kiss. TV guide was buried in a stand on not transportable. So, unless you can memorize 50 stations you have to drag the equivalent of key fob found in a gas station (BIG) to the bed. But, for $153 a night a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KLB8687
Reviews.Content: The Indigo had a very cool vibe, everything was bright & beachy. We stayed in a regular 2 bed room & it was a weird layout with the beds facing each other, but I can appreciate odd things like that after staying in a million hotels that all look the same. The room had a fridge & a microwave which came in handy. Also loved the Aveda products they have. The front desk ladies were very nice and helpful with recommendations. One of them even printed out a bunch of restaraunt menus & coupons for us! The hotel taxi will take you anywhere within 3 miles for free which worked out great for us. We found out taxis in the Dallas area cost double what they do in New Orleans.. kinda crazy. Maybe because Dallas is a lot more spread out. We did not use the valet as there was a parking lot a block down that cost $4 for 12 hours. We could see the car from our room, it is a safe lot. Only downside was with the 106 degree heat & the wind that we felt was more like a hot blow dryer... we wanted to jump in a pool asap... which the hotel didn't have. Overall, I would stay here again- no extra charges, staff was nice & helpful, within walking distance to food, bars & art museums- Sounds good to me!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, ideal for Deep Ellum”
Reviews.Author: camkwc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights when in Dallas to see friends. Our lunch and evening times were centred on the bars of Deep Ellum and this place is 2 minutes walk from those. We got a great deal on price for our rooms and would never have expected the quality for those prices. Modern and bright, lots of pillows (and I mean lots), friendly staff at the desk and understanding valet parking people. We didn't eat there (so can't rate that but restaurant looks fine) - go to one of the bars in Deep Ellum for food.

Reviews.Title: “a terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel_london_se1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two day in January and really liked this hotel. It's bright colours and friendly style and like an antidote to the rest of down town Dallas which is a bit soulless. I travel a lot on business so when I'm on holiday the last thing I want is anything that feels like a business hotel. That's mainly what I loved about the Hotel Indigo -- the rooms were fun, unstuffy and comfortable. The public areas were great too and we spent a happy evening with our drinks sitting on the sofas and using the public internet. Even the breakfast was good. If I'm ever in down town Dallas again I would definitely stay at the Hotel Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: jennifer_h_123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Indigo with a friend because we were attending a concert in the area. Upon arrival the staff was great! They were very friendly and helped with transportation to the concert. Once in the room we ordered room service, assuming it would be some time before they were able to deliver I asked about how long it would be, they told me 20 minutes and it arrived in 15! The room was clean and comfortable. This was my second time to stay at this hotel and I will be back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jaxmik
Reviews.Content: Set in downtown Dallas this hotel is within easy reach of the 6th Floor Museum, Deeley Plaza, Old Red Court House museum, Pioneer Plaza, Dallas World Aquarium and Dallas Heritage Village to name but a few. The rooms in this boutique hotel are beautifully decorated in bright colours and are well furnished. Everywhere you go in the hotel it is beautifully clean and well maintained. The Phi restaurant serves excellent food at a reasonable price. A real plus is the hotel's courtesy car & mini bus - available to take guests anywhere within a 3 mile radius and then a quick phone call to the hotel gets you picked up and returned to the hotel. The drivers are friendly and knowledgable - especially with advice on the best places to eat. In facte every single member of staff at the Hotel Indigo was wonderful, they are all very helpful, polite and professional and nothing is too much trouble for them. Special thanks to Mike Owen (Manager) for his assistance and kindness when there was a hitch. So if you're thinking of visiting Dallas in Texas I highly recommend the Hotel Indigo. We had a fab holiday and have wonderful memories.

Reviews.Title: “I have a great time and l will be back”
Reviews.Author: alfonsoh40
Reviews.Content: First I was recommended by a friend to stay at this hotel. I got there and I parked in the public parking for $4.00 a day (walking distance maybe 400 meters). The check in was super quick and the front office always was professional and asked me if everything was alright. I have best opportunity to meet the General Manager (Mike) he is down in the earth and make sure that my stay was pleasant and provided me with a fruit tray (thanks). Also Mike is a prior service Army with 7 years, if you are a service member do not hesitate to meet him and ask for a military rate. Over all I felt that I stayed in a 5 star hotel. Thanks for your hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cowgirlmmm1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business four a couple of weeks. The front desk staff was courteous. The shuttle driver was awesome, he knew so much about the city and it's history! The rooms were decorated very nicely and with comfortable beds. The hotel is a very old building, so the walls are thin, but overall kept up pretty well. I would go back for sure, but maybe not on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cute but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: SG425
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my teenage daughter and three of her friends while they attended a convention downtown. The hotel is cute and comfortable with a bar and restaurant and fitness center (which we did not use). Wireless is free and there is a nice lounge area downstairs with couches and a big screen TV. The hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants. Parking is valet only but there is a parking garage right across the street. A negative is there is no street parking which made drop off and pickup difficult since the girls had so much luggage and we simply could not schlep it down Main St. from the parking garage--my husband ended up having to illegally park on the street and rush in. Check in was smooth and friendly. There are several free (slow) computers for use in the lobby. The decor is all pastels but not garish--I thought it pretty but wondered what my husband would have thought of it. We chose a Queen Suite to sleep 4. I thought the room a little small and the big coffee table in front of the pullout sofa a nuisance. The tiny bathroom had 1 sink (but nice Aveda products). It wasn't exactly what I think of when I hear "suite" but it was cute and comfortable and had a microwave and fridge which was nice. The queen bed was comfortable and both the living area and bedroom had flat screen TVs--which were outdated, no HD and the one in the living area looked to be going out very soon. The bedroom had a private door--but it was hard to open and close and was so noisy we couldn't close it because if someone had to use the bathroom in the middle of the night it would have woken up everyone. The hotel itself was quiet though even though we were right by the elevator. The only noise was street noise which I got used to. Overall I would stay here again for this event as it was quiet and comfortable and in a good location. But I thought the rate high as there was no HD television or pool. This would be a nice stay for the business traveler or for locals like us that have an event downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: RachelEff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while in town to see the musical "Wicked." My fiance and I made a long weekend out of it and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were spacious and clean and decorated in beautiful bright blues and yellows. The bed was so comfortable and the rooms were quiet. Also, it smelled SO good. Wierd observation, but true! As far as location, we were within walking distance of a few pubs/restaurants and were able to duck into a sports bar and catch some of the World Cup. The service was also top tier. We ate at the hotel restaurant for breakfast on of the mornings and I was absolutely thrilled with the waitstaff. We were given prompt service and the food was really good. When we wanted to change an item on the menu, the waitress even suggested an option that accommodated out request and saved us money. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you're staying in downtown Dallas, make it the Indigo”
Reviews.Author: mfkne
Reviews.Content: A lot has been said about the Hotel Indigo and all I can do is really chime in on the praise for this property. The staff are very friendly, the rooms are very spacious and cosy (I actually felt kind of at home and that says a lot about a hotel room) and sleep quality was very good too. Thanks to its location anything in downtown Dallas is within 15 minutes of walking distance, but should you prefer to get a ride, just ask at reception since the hotel provides a complimentary shuttle service to anywhere within 3 miles of the hotel. Once again, the stay has been a pleasant finale of our trip and should I ever return to Dallas I would certainly stay at the Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, great staff”
Reviews.Author: fmfrannieco
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The staff was great and empowered to make guests happy. I travel almost weekly for business and rarely do I see a property "stand out". The Hotel Indigo was great value. I love the decor, but what was truly impressive: the flawless customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and welcoming atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: cocolobaglades
Reviews.Content: Helpful and friendly staff. Room comfy, quiet, and spacious. Room service quick. Only complaint is the lack of soy milk.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel and its staff made our medical stay sooooo easy and wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: krchhff
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite a surprise; it wasn't like a hotel, but more like an exclusive and luxuious botique inn. The staff was amazing; helpful and friendly in ways that couldn't be faked. The room was so comforting and "soft." The colors, bedding and arrangement were just what my sister and I needed. We are going to back just to stay in our same room for pleasure. We used the shuttle extensively and every single one of the drivers was great. The restaurant staff, the check-in staff...they were all wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: LondonRoyston
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in March 2011 and had booked a triple room. On checking in to the hotel there was a problem with the receiption staff finding our booking, which resulted with a fair bit of wait - approximately 40 mins. However, the staff were very friendly and apologetic and offered us drinks whilst we waited - how you deal with a problem is a big plus with me and the hotel staff did a good job. The hotel is very well layed out and the rooms are of a good size and very clean. We had a slight problem with our shower head and informed receiption who fixed the problem that very same afternoon. This hotel has great staff, rooms, layout and is in a fantastic location. Ironically my actual job is investigating hotel complaints for a travel company in the UK and I personnally would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What happen to the Indigo thought downtown would rate better”
Reviews.Author: MauiPigFarmer
Reviews.Content: I really do not know where to start because we have stayed at other Indigo's and have been extremely pleased. Front desk took 30 minutes to check us in with little or no concern for apology or adding a thank you. The other desk clerk did not want to help but she was very attentive to the three or four that checked in while we stood and waited. Room 311 we had has a wonderful view of HVAC equipment 2 feet from the window and infested with pigeons and poop. Hope the fresh air intakes did not come from that area. I went down for morning coffee at 8 am and it was gone when i turned the front desk just smiles. I came back in 15 minutes and the station was taken up so much that. The room was okay not really Indigo standard level. The bed seem to be full size not queen because we sleep on a queen. The bed did not have the upgraded Indigo line as San Antonio Indigo. There is a hole in the bathroom door along with the doors at an angle you can see have been wiped with a dirty rag. The micro fridge did not work and made a bad noise when cycling so it is unplugged. The Main Street door smells like sewer gas and should be washed down. The two people that are above the others is the welcome stand at the main entrance and the concierge manager the shuttle bus driver even greeted us as we left the hotel and he was walking around to shuttle someone but the others seem as if it is just a job. We travel to Dallas very frequently and have put this hotel on the bottom of the list. The property is not up to a downtown establishment. Thank you for your time of this review. Hope it finds the hotel in a position to reflect the statue of customer relations.

Reviews.Title: “it was an amazing experience and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Gigikrks
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, very promp and accurate i loved how the room was set up, the colors (very bright, makes you happy) almost felt like your own apartment :) the location was good for what i know, it had a shuttle to take you place and can walk around downtown to shop, eat, etc.. The best part about the hotel was the staff..they were in great spirit.... i honestly can say i dont have anything to say "least" about the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: atokaok
Reviews.Content: We did not even know about this hotel, until recommended by the Baylor Hospital Hotel, and now we stay at the Indigo whenever in town, especially on visitsto Baylor. The hotel is historic, yet up to date in every aspect. The staff was not just friendly but highly motivated to see that the guest's every need was met, great service abounds at every level. The bar and grill was conveniently located in the lobby with a great menu and the same great service as the rest of the Indigo. We recommend the Indigo without reservations!

Reviews.Title: “Broken exercise machines, inaudible tv, crowded room”
Reviews.Author: LeakyB85
Reviews.Content: Among the four machines that I could use (two elliptical, two treadmills), only one worked. Two were marked "out of order," and one elliptical kept turning on and off so that periodically you were jerked out of control. I reported this the first morning of a 3-night trip and nothing new happened while I was there. The tv in my room was so quiet that some channels were completely inaudible. The main part of the room (not including entry or bathroom) was about 18 feet long by 10 feet wide. So it was surprising to find a queen bed, a love seat sofabed, a 3'x4' table (to be used as desk), a 2'x4' coffee table, a lounge chair, a desk chair, a 3' diameter 3' tall table (use?), two bedside tables, and a 6' tall x 4' wide by 2' deep tv and storage cabinet. Wow! I could hardly move around. Everything has a kind of cheap look, including the amazing wallpaper of plants and fruits (like the platter-size blueberries behind the bed). It was a little scary to be out at night, but that is probably to be expected in a city downtown. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience and nice respite from the average hotel”
Reviews.Author: baillie10
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with my visit. When I got there, the outside looked like an older hotel and I thought what have I done. It is the oldest hotel in Dallas (very interesting history), but it has been renovated and is different from your average "same" hotel. The deco was really unique with colors, writing, nautilus shells, etc. My room was spacious, clean, and quaint. It had two beds, a large working desk (with convenient outlets), microwave, and fridge. The tv was older, but the manager said they were in the process of changing them out. The bathroom had plenty of counter space, a real shower with tile, and a closet. The fitness club had bikes, steppers, treadmill, and weights. Right across the street was a park, and you could walk around downtown to restaurants, pubs, etc. Neat place to explore from, although I was there on business so I didn't get to really take advantage. The staff were exceptional...very friendly, helpful, always said hi. Anything I asked, they took care of. It felt like those hotels that you see in the movies where people actually lived there, and the staff remembers you. I really enjoyed my stay and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Downtown Dallas Option”
Reviews.Author: mke60
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel well located in downtown Dallas. Renovated older building with some charm. Good value for a downtown property. Rooms of varying size and configuration. We had a room with two beds at the end of the hall that was small and narrow with the beds on either end of the room. That configuration made watching the (tube) TV impossible from either bed. Room was decorated in bright colors, was very clean and otherwise comfortable. Small bathroom (that included the closet) with nice shower (no tub). The desk staff was courteous and efficient but not overly knowledgeable. However the best asset of the hotel was the bell staff who were knowledgeable, extremely helpful and staffed a shuttle that was always ready for us on a moment's notice to take us to any location within the immediate downtown area. In addition to the shuttle, it's a manageable 2-3 block walk to the DART, making this an excellent choice if your purpose in Dallas is primarily downtown venues or if you don't have a car. If you will be commuting by car to all of your destinations in the vast North TX area, I'd stay somewhere with free parking and good freeway access. We wanted to get Bloody Mary's Sunday mid morning with a late breakfast, but were shut out and told that the bar didn't open until 4pm. I would recommend the Hotel Indigo for anyone requiring a moderately priced option in downtown Dallas thatâ€™s not over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Employees were very helpful and exceptionally friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Boeingbbj
Reviews.Content: Entire staff went out of their way to make our visit very enjoyable. From the valets to the front desk and a special thanks to the restaurant staff. The restaurant staff was there early in the morning and late at night and they always had a smile on their face. Maid service was also excellent. Older facility with a lot of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hniki234
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I went to Dallas for a girls' weekend and stayed at Hotel Indigo. I absolutely loved this place and the suite we booked! I'm a huge fan of the bright colors they used and love the wall murals. The colors made me feel calm and happy. The pillows were awesome, and the mattress was (while not THE best) one of the best I've slept on at a hotel. While our suite was located directly across from the elevators, we had no problems with noise. However, I don't think they were very busy during our stay. I had no security concerns while staying there and all of the staff members were pleasant. We had a $30 credit for breakfast each morning. and we were thrilled with the portions they gave us! (We ordered a fruit bowl to go and received a large styrofoam container of fresh fruit!) The only real negative is that the rooms are pretty small. Our suite consisted of a small bedroom, a bathroom with a shower only, and a decent sized living area with a small fridge, microwave, desk, 2 couches, and a coffee table. TVs were located in both the bedroom and the living area. The TVs were not flat screen but older models; however, the picture was fine. All in all, I thought the suite was really cute, but. if you're looking for a large bedroom, then you might be disappointed. In the end, I'll definitely be staying at Hotel Indigo again! It was a fun experience!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience and Excellent Customer Care”
Reviews.Author: mavium
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo was the meeting hotel for our annual conference at the end of January. The Hotel Indigo staff went out of their way to ensure that each meeting attendee had a pleasent stay and that every need of our attendees was meet above their expectations. The staff is to be commended. Overall the stay, breakfast options, and assistance provided by the Hotel Indigo team was exceptional. Looking to come back to Hotel Indigo in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: ConnieRuston717270
Reviews.Content: This is a older hotel that has been renovated and it is a boutique hotel. The staff goes above and beyond...they put hospitality in the hospitality business! The food is excellent and fresh. Front desk staff were warm and friendly and very helpful. The rooms are a little smaller than expected but they are Spotless!! Aveda toilietry items are included. The housekeeping staff always makes eye contact and speaks. I would highly recommend this hotel for a change from the typical Marriott and Hilton hotels!! Love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, comfy, clean.. well worth the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lots-of-lollies
Reviews.Content: wow, the best hotel by far!!!!!!! The team at indigo were friendly and always there to help (even in the early hours). The rooms were perfect!!!! had everything!! (big comfy beds were a major plus). Location was really good everything i needed was walking distance anything that wasnt was a short ride (which the hotel provided, again major plus). Clean, friendly staff, good location...what more could you want? Thankyou to the team at indigo!!! would definately be back again.

Reviews.Title: “'Nice little find”
Reviews.Author: ls1202
Reviews.Content: The last few Christmas' my husband and I have spent a day Christmas shopping and then spent the night in a somewhat local hotel ... kind of a little getaway during the hectic Holidays. This year we choose Hotel Indigo in downtown Dallas. On the outside the hotel looks old and stately (it HAS been there a long time). But once you walk in the door you are transformed to a bright, cheerful updated interior. Everything is done in blues, yellows and greens. There are alot of beach motifs. On a gray December afternoon it was quite a transformation. We loved it. We stayed on a Monday night so it was very quiet. Our room was a little small but everything was updated and very comfortable. The bed was VERY comfortable and plush. Hotel Indigo was a nice little find! 'Very relaxing and cozy after a long day of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: Dallas37
Reviews.Content: The hotel is unique and has a great location in downtown. I was happy with the room and loved that they had a stand alone shower in the bathroom. I will note that the fire alarm began to malfunction in my room about the time i tried to get to sleep...but upon calling the front desk, a maintenance man responded and corrected the problem quickly. Things happen and in this case they dealt with it swiftly. I can't comment on the parking...due to my booking rate, I received complimentary valet service, so I was pleased with that. I can say that the front door man was not helpful or pleasant. He just gave off the attitude that he was there because he had to be and nothing more. Not sure if he was part of the valet service or part of the hotel, but either way, a more pleasant first impression would have been great. Overall this was a great hotel and excellent value. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly service, unique rooms”
Reviews.Author: gjnbln
Reviews.Content: The room felt more like an apartment than a hotel, which I thought was nice. hardwood floors throughout. The location is a little shady, however you can walk to the Dart to take you anywhere. The staff were all nice.

Reviews.Title: “Grat little hotel in center of Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Entente-cordiale
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Indigo for 4 nights for the World Series. It was very well located, next to quite a few restaurants, opposite a few parkings, and within 20mn walk of the Sixth Floor Museum or Downtown. They also offer a free shuttle. The rooms are cosy, but of a good size, and although small the bathroom has everything you could need, and a lot of storage. Reception staff was lovely and very informative, and they have a restaurant that serves breakfast. We found the entire staff to be very helpful, and very welcoming. A lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel Not too commercial”
Reviews.Author: skydeeva
Reviews.Content: I am a die hard Redskin Fan (born and raised in D.C.) so when it comes to Dallas it is hard for me to find anything to like, however; When I arrived at the Hotel Indigo I found out that this hotel was the first Hilton Hotel in America. (Now remodeled and part of the Holiday Inn Corp.) I was able to obtain Priority Club points. The architecture in the lobby was art deco/southwestern style. It was very quaint and cozy. The service at the front desk was quick and efficient. There was never a long wait for the elevators. Try to request room 913. It is across from the elevator, but you never hear it. Room 913 has a nice sitting area with a couple of couches and the bedroom sits off in the back. The hotel has a feeling of home. The only itemed that I missed was an HDTV or Flat Screen television in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, and clean!”
Reviews.Author: MMMMmmm_or_not
Reviews.Content: This place was overall great. The location is prime...you can walk to many places to eat, the art museum, the sculpture museum, public transportation. It is directly across from a cute little park and the Majestic Theater. The room was exceptionally clean. I liked the decor so much...they incorporate lots of dramatic color and wall paper made of pictures into all the Indigo hotels I have been to. This one had wallpaper made from a photo of blueberries. It is anything but traditional but I think it looks amazing. When wefirst got to Dallas it was fairly early in the day so our room wasn't ready yet (totally our fault for being that early). The staff so kindly helped my husband find a quiet place to take a work teleconference call, watched our luggage while we went to get some lunch and then let us know as soon as our room was ready.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: kp_ross
Reviews.Content: My fiancee had to go to a conference in downtown Dallas, so me being 3 months pregnant decided to tag along. We are both hotel managers, so typically when we stay somewhere we're pretty harsh critics. I must say that I have never enjoyed a room as much as I did at this hotel. I was unfamilar with the Hotel Indigo brand but after the first night I was in love! I felt like I was on the beach- so it was a big let-down to walk outside and feel the cold November weather.The rooms were very clean beds extraordinarily comfortable. Probably my only complaint was that by being an older hotel, the room and bathroom were both pretty small. Not like anyone can change that, not without major renovations and some seroius knocking down of walls. Since I was sick due to the pregnancy, I was pretty confined to the room. I did however manage to check out the lobby which was large and also very beautiful. I also noticed a small bar/restaurant that looked pretty cozy. I rarely eat at hotel restaurants though, they tend to be pretty pricey. From one hotel manager to the other- Great job at this one guys!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive & satisfied”
Reviews.Author: diamond_queen14
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Indigo from Oct 21st thru Oct 24th. This trip was my second trip to Dallas, and this time I was attending the "Woman Thou Art Loosed" conference at 'The Potter's House,' and was able to get a one bedroom hotel at a great price. I was very impressive by the style of my room; I love the painted background in the bedroom behind the headboard and the colors went together so beautifully. I was also happy to be able to plug in my Laptop & utilize the hotel's internet connection. I almost consider my room like a mini-apartment room, & I love the hardwood floors (so much better than dirty carpet). The only bad critique that I will give the hotel is concerning the valet guy on today (Sunday). I had just come from church, and I had to check out of the hotel asap...I didn't have any small bills to tip the valet guy (I had been tipping everyday for valet) to come upstairs with the cart to grab my luggage so I grabbed the cart myself and brought it upstairs to load my luggage myself. One of the valet guys saw me with the cart, but he didn't offer to help at all. Once I made it back downstairs, I guess he figured that I wouldn't tip him b/c I got my own bags, so (again) he didn't even offer to put my bags in my car!! I was appalled. He sat behind the little wooden stand just looking at a woman load up her car with luggage. I thought to myself that it's really sad that these valet guys will only move or operate off a tip, and not provide good customer service. When he saw the cart rolling towards my car, he ran and grabbed it, but at that point I was disgusted and thinking, "It's too late to help now!" Nevertheless, I enjoyed my room...it was peaceful & relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a weekend with the girls!”
Reviews.Author: kmnorton63
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I decided to meet in Dallas for her birthday. I chose the Hotel Indigo because the location was walking to Deep Ellum for the day. There were also some fantastic restaurants within walking distance in the Power and Light district. The hotel was a good price, very clean, the bed was comfortable. The lobby and rooms are decorated so cute. The staff was extremely nice. Although the items in the lobby cafe/bar were a little pricey (but to be expected) the food and service was fantastic. I definitely look forward to staying here again when I visit Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: auvoir
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the very best staff of any place I have ever been. Everyone has a genuine smile and a desire to help in any way possible. The location on the edge of downtown is fine, within walking distance of many restaurants as well as Neiman-Marcus. The dining room has excellent food to go along with the excellent service. We were there on a very busy weekend, the Oklahoma-Texas football game. Rooms were pricey. Upon checkin there was a discrepency between the pre-arranged price and the price given at the desk. As I was hunting the printout, the desk clerk found a handicap room for us at a wonderful price. True, it was small, had a view of a littered rooftop, and we could not see even a sliver of the sky. But the overall hotel experience was balanced by the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “First Time is the Charm”
Reviews.Author: joydel
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely helpful friendly. They offer a free shuttle within a 3 mile radius and this is worth a few bucks if you don't know the area and don't want to have to take a taxi. The rooms were nice, beds, comfy. The lobby had a nice casual atmosphere. We traveled with teenagers. Lots of computers for all to enjoy without waiting on the one laptop we brought along. An overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: obimon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Indigo for a few days on a sight-seeing trip to Dallas and the surrounding areas. The hotel is nicely situated in the city's downtown area with several restaurants and bars within walking distance. As others have indicated, the hotel boasts a "beach" theme with an indigo and yellow color scheme on the walls and furnishings. Rooms are spacious and clean, and the staff is very helpful and friendly. Definitely a relaxing ambience. We used the valet and had no problems. The valet guys are prompt and very friendly. Always greeted with a smile. Walls are somewhat thin, as we could hear conversations and television noise from a neighboring room. Since the hotel did not provide a book outlining all of their services, we needed to ask several questions at the front desk. We needed to ask for an ironing board and an ice bucket, and the hours of room service. But the staff was very helpful in answering our questions. Televisions are older-model tube types with very spotty analog cable. That could be improved. Otherwise, a very nice stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: madhvi116
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. It was a smaller boutique hotel so it had an intimate feel about it along with being very cozy. I would recommend staying here as the employees of the hotel were very friendly and knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: joeblow56137
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Indigo and reserved a block of rooms for members of the wedding party and others who needed a place to stay. The reception ballroom was down the street. The staff was helpful, starting with the reservations, and asking management for additional rooms. (This was during the State Fair and University of Texas-Oklahoma game week.) The desk clerk (Tricia? Tanya?) was especially helpful, and all of the bellhops were ready to serve at a moment's notice. The valet parking service was helpful and quick. The cafeteria menu was somewhat limited, but offered enough variety for our stay. The prices were about what one would expect from a hotel of this level. The free wireless Internet in the room came in handy. Tbe only drawback, as we saw it, was that the rooms were somewhat smaller than what one would get at Hampton Inn, Embassy Suites, Holiday Inn, et al. We had a suite, and that probably had a bi more room than other guest rooms. The coffee maker made one cup at a time, and had one cup available, so that was a bit awkward for two people. Other people we had reserved rooms also felt favorably towards the hotel. We want to stay here during a vacation we hope to take in summer 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: jeaninohio2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled to Dallas before and have stayed at the 5 star hotels. Not anymore! Hotel Indigo has beat all expectations of a great hotel stay. My husband is currently in the middle of his stay, and he can say that the hotel is perfect for his business trip. The room is clean, up to date, and has all of the amenities he needs. The room service he has ordered has been excellent and is very fairly priced! Like other reviewers, the staff knows him by name. Very similar to the "boutique hotel" experience. Next time we travel to downtown Dallas, Hotel Indigo will be our first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Going to the beach in downtow Dallas”
Reviews.Author: nmbjnye
Reviews.Content: The decor is light and fun with the feeling of the Oregon Beach rather than mid Texas. The staff was very helpful and all the needs we had for completing our task as a group arriving from five different states were met. Very clean. Good food in the restaurant. Helpful shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Will not consider staying anywhere else in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: sezzmi
Reviews.Content: Great place, feels like a beach house. Great staff. We live in Dallas, and just wanted a night away from home. I will tell everyone I know about this place. It's close enough to anything you want to do, and comfortable enough to just stay in the room. Hated to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in every way, everyone should stay here.”
Reviews.Author: jdefalco
Reviews.Content: I had a trip that had been cancelled at the last minute due to flight problems, I was not within the time frame to cancel for a refund at the hotel. The manager, Mike Owen advised that he would honor my reservation at another time. He did not forget me when I needed to reschedule MONTHS later. He went well above and beyond to make my stay pleasant and confortable. He even upgraded my room to a suite. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone that is staying in Dallas. Everything about this hotel was top of the line.

Reviews.Title: “One of the warmest experiences I've had with a hotel”
Reviews.Author: tap062
Reviews.Content: I have told everyone I work with what a wonderful hotel, Indigo, turned out to be. Not only are the rooms cozy, but the staff is incredible. The doorman, shuttle bus driver, housekeepers, front desk will all go out of their way to make your stay the most enjoyable ever. The rooms are squeaky clean, the beds are comfortable and the linens are fresh (smells wonderful) and changed everyday. If I ever go back, I am certainly using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Family”
Reviews.Author: IBM_Piper
