Reviews.Content: For the past 3Â½ years I have been commuting between my home town of New Braunfels, Texas and Dallas, Texas on business. My first stay with the Hotel Indigo was in December 2006. The Hotel Indigo is located across the street from our Dallas Office and connected with an enclosed sky-bridge, making it especially convenient during inclement weather. Making a long story short, six months into my 3Â½ year venture, our Dallas office relocated four city blocks away and across the street from a four star hotel in direct competition with the Hotel Indigo. One would think that that is where I would be staying, particularly because of the new found conveniences and at no cost to me since my company picks up the tab. However, my loyalties belong to the Hotel Indigo. The entire staff is the friendliest I have ever encountered in my travels for both business and leisure. From my first stay in December 2006 though today they have all treated me like family. For example, in April 2007 I spent my first birthday away from home. To my surprise upon my return at the end of the work day from the office, the staff at the hotel greeted me at the front desk with a birthday card and my very favorite, chocolate cake. I was wowed off my feet at the pleasant surprise. I am affectionately referred as the Chicken Man. It has been my pleasure to return kindness with kindness, so whenever I arrive at the hotel on a Tuesday evening, I try my best to make a fried chicken run, my treat, for everyone. Fried Chicken is a fond childhood memory that I have. For years my dad worked two jobs and when he had a few extra bucks he bought fried chicken for dinner but only on Sundays. I can still recall those evenings when my brother, sisters, mom and dad sat around our 13â€� black and white television set watching the Ed Sullivan Show eating Churchâ€™s Fried Chicken. Well I have created new fond memories with the staff of the Hotel Indigo with lessons learned from my dad. Thanks Pop! Did I forget to mention that the beds are very comfortable, the rooms are very clean, the restaurant & bar is awesome and like the sitcom â€œCheersâ€� everyone knows your name! And yes, I have observed other guest given the same courtesies.

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT!”
Reviews.Author: VanaDallas
Reviews.Content: The staff this weekend was AWESOME.... They truly went over and beyond to make sure my ladies were comfortable. They all said this was the best staff we have experienced at any of the locations we have stayed in the past years.The staff possessed a generous hospitality and were beautiful people in all areas. Not one of my ladies came in contact with a staff member they did not love. They all did great and should be commended for their professionalism and friendliness. I am so glad that my ladies were able to experience what a good hotel staff should be like!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: dgg747
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Indigo because the large hotel where my conference was located was full. I am so glad that happened! This hotel, while a little smaller than some of the larger, more expensive hotels, has some great things going for it. The rooms are very comfortable. Hardwood floors, extremely comfortable beds. The restaurant is great, but the best thing about this hotel is how friendly the entire staff is. In the three days I stayed, there was never once that a member of the hotel staff didn't smile, say hello and ask if there was anything they could do to make my stay better. From Dennis, the concierge, to the young lady working in the restaurant, everyone was extremely nice, helpful, and welcoming. I will definitely stay here again, as my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Best Downtown Dallas experience!”
Reviews.Author: kmiller1415
Reviews.Content: I couldn't wait to get back from the tradeshow each day to this hotel! It was friendly and comfortable in every way, from the bright lobby and sitting areas to the plush bedding, but the best thing about it was the way the staff went out of their way to take care of us. There was plenty of space to work in my room, but it was also nice to work in the comfy work centers in the lobby. Every single staff member I encountered over 5 days was warm and helpful. This would be my first choice in Dallas if/when I return.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel definitely made our trip a success”
Reviews.Author: punkieontheroad
Reviews.Content: A smallish boutique style hotel has a completely different feel than the fancy chains in the area. By the time we left we were well-acquainted with the manager, who was extremely helpful, the desk clerks and the bartender. We inquired about a nearby restaurant and were offered a coupon for 10% off our bill there. We didn't have to drive anywhere, as the hotel provided transportation to and from our event about a mile away. This service ends at !0:00p.m. so I guess we were fortunate the concert ended early. The bar was still open when we got back and the bartender was charming and helped us recover from a great but too-short show. .All in all a more than pleasant experience...my only problem was finding an ATM nearby; there are huge banks everywhere but the only available ATM was in a convenience store!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation while working!!!”
Reviews.Author: nowayhosea
Reviews.Content: I have lost count of how many nights the Indigo has hosted me because when I am in Dallas, I ALWAYS stay there!! (In fact, I just got home this evening and I am going back to the Indigo on Monday, when I have to fly back to Dallas!) We are talking years of repeat business!! The staff are the most friendly, accomodating group of people that I have ever seen in a hotel environment. The lobby, rooms and entire hotel are so beautifully decorated and I always feel like I am on vacation when I walk in the door, even though I have only been there for work purposes. I always come back and they make me want to!! I especially enjoy the suites, the in-room microwave and fridge and the breakfasts at Phi. The beds are comfy, cozy and the decor is amazing!! I also really appreciate the free washer and dryer on the 6th floor. They understand my needs as a frequent traveler with four business work-stations (computers and printers that work!). The hotel shuttle is so helpful, parking right across the street is easy access and I can also walk most places, if I desire! Trust me!! If you want to truly experience a difference, try the Indigo! You will love it!!

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest place this side of DisneyWorld”
Reviews.Author: GoIrish55138
Reviews.Content: The Indigo is a really nice "boutique" hotel. The rooms are comfortable and tastefully decorated. We have stayed at many hotels and have never experienced a more friendly, welcoming, service conscious staff. You arrive as a customer, but leave as a friend. These folks are genuine! The price point is very fair. Consider purchasing one of their "breakfast included" packages as there are few convenient alteratives. If you have a car consider valet parking. The nearest garage can be very expensive if you go in and out multiple times per day. History minded Dallas visitors will enjoy this place as it is very near several historic sites. The hotel itself has a historic past. This hotel does a great job supporting wedding parties, baby showers, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Usual”
Reviews.Author: taterbugportland
Reviews.Content: Looking for something besides the big box hotels that have no charm? The Indigo Hotel is very charming. The rooms are decorated like a cottage, very clean, spacious and offered a comfortable stay. I have never stayed in a hotel where everyone was so friendly. They have 4 computers in the lobby available for access versus the usual 1 so you don't have to wait. Best of all there is free Internet access and they don't charge for printing. Free Wi-Fi in the rooms. The restaurant in the lobby is very good and offers dinner. There is not much shopping within walking distance except Neiman Marcus but lots of good restaurants only 1-2 blocks away. I was looking for something that had some charm and was not so massive and this was it.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: SouthernQT
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located very close to many businesses as well as the convention center. Ask Franklin the bellman about the historica significants of the Hotel...so very interesting if you are a history buff! Rooms are comfortable and clean and the service is great. Will be back on my next business trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Biby76
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say that this was a great hotel with the best service. Their customer service was excellent and they provided a very good experience while we were in Dallas for a few days, the staff made us feel right at home and greeted us with a smile every chance they got. Highly recommended! P.S. The Bell Boys are the best in town.

Reviews.Title: “We shall return !!”
Reviews.Author: volleyball2010
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Indigo in Downtown Dallas was wonderful. The entire staff was extremely helpful both before we arrived and during our stay. We especially appreciated the Concierge's suggestions for restaurants and activities around town. And the shuttle drivers worked hard transporting the large gruop of volleyball players that were at the hotel at the time. We will return to enjoy your hotel again. Thank you !! Amy (New York)

Reviews.Title: “The most pleasant staff I've encountered in a long time”
Reviews.Author: sasTexasTravel
Reviews.Content: In Dallas for a conference, I was pleasantly surprised to find the Indigo more comfortable and friendlier than I expected. The staff was always knowledgeable and helpful, and they really went out of their way to help. The room was comfortable - terrific bed and pillows - and I slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great bargain, no hesitation that we would return!”
Reviews.Author: thecoaling
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location, comfortable lounge, great breakfast. Self park just across the street. A great bargain - would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Indigo gives the best experience in boutique hotels!”
Reviews.Author: UniqueTraveler70
Reviews.Content: When you are looking for a hotel that has a staff that cares, a healthy environment that is really physically clean, moderate prices, and a great fun, funky attitude â€“ you need to stay at the Hotel Indigo. Weâ€™ve just completed a 4-night/5 day stay in Dallas. Some work/some play. The Indigo has a van that will drive/pick you up anywhere in a 3 mile radius â€“ great way to save $, tip the drivers â€“ they earn it and you have still saved a bundle in cab fares. If you have Rubin as your driver you get the history of Dallas during your journey. The concierge, Mike, sends you to great restaurants. You tell him what you want and he knows a moderate price restaurant, within 3 miles, that has attentive service and excellent food choices. If you donâ€™t know what you want, heâ€™ll suggest a good place. The entire hotel is in shades of blue and yellow â€“ very cheerful, like the staff. The rooms have hardwood floors, very comfortable beds, coffee makers and refrigerator. We asked for a quite room â€“ we had read on TA that the hotel could get noisy. The staff made sure. that we were far from the party people â€“ the management knows what it is doing! Amenities are high end, Starbucks has a great bartista, breakfasts are very good & reasonable. There is wireless through the hotel and the â€œliving room â€œ atmosphere in the lobby makes it a great place to unwind outside your room. The front desk staff Kathy, daytime, and Trina, evenings, always had smiles for us and wanted to know if there was anything we needed. This staff cares and it shows. Only suggestion, if you like a room To physically spread out your â€œstuffâ€� â€“ get a suite. Regular rooms are fine, but more than 2 people or sports equipment, etc. a larger room is a better. Love the Indigo â€“ we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for friendly service, great rooms, and location”
Reviews.Author: MrsHaugh
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel I stay at in Dallas. I go there for business mostly, but would also go there for lesiure too. It is located close to shopping, resturants and nightlife. The hotel shuttle will also take you to resturants that are a little farther than walking distance. They staff is very friendly, and accomodating. They are the same people I've been seeing for 3 years, so it must be a great place to work. The beds are to die for. I don't ever want to get up in the morning because they're so comfy. The bathrooms are awesome with aveda amenities and detachable shower heads. The resturant/bar, Phi, is really good too. They have fabulous muffins and breakfast food as well as dinners too. I had the queso dip (or something like that) one night when I was staying by myself and it was sooo good! I would reccomend this hotel to anyone whether it be business, leisure, families, or newlyweds.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: moja2
Reviews.Content: All of the staff was so gracious, helpful and nice, especially Dennis. The man at the front desk was also great and helped with dinner reservations and travel around the city. The bell hops were also terrific. It is so relaxing to know that the employees will take care of you. Thank you to the staff at Hotel Indigo!! You are the BEST!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Big Box Hotel, but a Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gqnupe1911
Reviews.Content: I was booking my hotel a little late, a week before my Event. The Host Hotel was 'The Sheraton'(Big Box Hotel Chain). As a result, I wasnâ€™t getting a good price on the room, and I decided to shop. I usually skeptical of lower priced hotels that are not â€œName Brandâ€�, but I decided to try Hotel Indigo. I actually was able to book my whole trip including air/hotel for less than it would have cost to stay at the host hotel. I must say I am delighted I was willing to try something new. The hotel has a stylish boutique design and feel, and the room was very cozy. Not to mention that the feel was different than any other hotel stay that I have ever had because of the Night Manager â€“Trina- that checked me, and did whatever she could to make my stay the best. Now you may just think she was doing her job, but I felt as a hotel guest that she went the extra mile, and even made me feel like I was a local business that really appreciated my business. As a result she remembered my name, and kindly would inquire how my meetings for day were going, and if there was anything she could help me with. I know people say we are in a recession, but I believe we are in a period of weeding out, and survival of the fittest in our economy- It are businesses like the Hotel Indigo, that will build a reputation for being the best small and service oriented hotels, that will be in business and going strong for years to come as a result of taking care of their customers. Side Note- as I left the conference on Sunday, I couldnâ€™t help but notice the long lines of people that stood impatiently waiting to check-out and check-in at the host hotel â€“ The Sheraton, and all I could do was laugh since I not only stayed at a better hotel- but It was by far best VALUE. If I ever have a conference again or know of someone coming to Dallas for business, and they want the best service, and best value to choose Hotel Indigo- and support the businesses that spur this economy! If you decide to stay there as a result of this review...Be sure to tell Trina, the Night Manager---That Mr. Lee reommended you stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Staff! Gerardo, Early, Trina & Katy deserve a huge raise! *****5 STAR SERVICE*****”
Reviews.Author: Ellexis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Dallas for the Jesus Christ Superstar Rock Opera (starring Ted Neeley!) and decided on Hotel Indigo due to its location. The Majestic Theatre is just around the corner, which is where the performance took place. We couldn't have picked a better hotel or location. Their entire staff was friendly, however, certain members really shined and certainly went well beyond what we expected or have ever experienced during our frequent travels. Gerardo at the front desk made us immediately feel welcomed, as did Trina and Katy. Each of them should be the envy of the numerous hotel chains in the downtown area. Hotel Indigo is fortunate to have a staff second to none who make their patrons feel like family instead of a room number. Early, who works in the restaurant as a bus boy is a true gentleman. He too went well out of his way, even to help us with the Valet parking procedure. His smile is infectious and matches his kind heart! In fact, that description fits each of these individuals, and seriously, they deserve top pay and then some! We absolutely will stay at Hotel Indigo again when we're back in Dallas. I would be willing to bet they'll remember us by name and give us the same 5-Star service once again! For example; Checkout time was 12-noon on Sunday, yet the Jesus Christ Superstar performance wasn't until 1pm. We didn't want to keep our luggage, laptop other valuables in our vehicle during the performance, nor did we really want to have to move our car to another parking garage. I spoke to Trina about this and she said they would be delighted to store our luggage, laptop and other items in a secure area, giving us a claim ticket for each bag. Furthermore, she said our vehicle was not a problem, and they would not require us to move it even after the checkout time. What a relief! If you're in the Dallas area, we highly recommend Hotel Indigo! Tell them Ellexis and Jeff sent you!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful renovation of an old building, refreshing, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: jamirushford
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a renovated 'old timer' Dallas location, beautiful lobby, restaurant & sitting area. Staff was very friendly, wonderful group of folks to work with. Fitness center was also nice. Big drawback to the hotel would be internet access in the rooms. The wireless on the 14th floor never got anything better then a weak signal and most of the time when it connected to this network it would come back with limited or no connectivity. I used the Baylor Medical Center guest internet access which was a much stronger signal then the network provided by the hotel. So if you plan on working from the hotel (VPN or the like), it's not going to happen!!!!! It was really bad, I spent 1.5 hours one evening trying to modify a configuration file on a system via VPN and it dropped the connection about every 30 seconds, and again this wasn't the hotel network, because that network could never successfully negotiate a VPN connection.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: CAScubaNut
Reviews.Content: During my husband's cancer treatment at "Baylor University Medical Center" in Dallas, Texas, Hotel Indigo & all of the employees have been a "Home Away From Home" for my husband & myself. They have taken excellent care of us during this very difficult time, and we will continue to stay with them each time we go to "Baylor" for treatment. They have become part of our family.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay at Hotel Indigo”
Reviews.Author: Equity
Reviews.Content: I staeyd at Hotel Indigo for two nights this week while on a business trip to Dallas. Being a platinum Priority Club member I was upgraded to a suite. The hotel is in the downtown Dallas area which was very convenient for my purposes. I cannot overstate how accomodating and helpful the staff is. They go the extra mile for their guests and one is made to feel most welcome here. It is almost like staying with family. The hotel itself is decorated in an indigo blue and bright yellow motif. The rooms are spacious and quiet. The bed was very comfortable, but the pillows could be improved as they were a bit hard. Bathroom amenities were good. An extra bar of soap for the shower was needed. The hotel restaurant was pleasant and service was fast. Food was good too and fairly priced. My room rate, booked on the hotel's web site, of $129/night was an excellent value. I will definitely stay here again next time I travel to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “If the stay is great, nothing can touch you!”
Reviews.Author: skampijoe
Reviews.Content: The eight days at Indigo were a real pleasure. Although almost everything went wrong referring to the trip (lost luggage, missed plain), the staff at Indigo did their best to make our journey as pleasant as possible - and they really succeeded. In addition, the hotel offers room quite generously, be it at the restaurant, in the chamber or at the fitness site. All parts of the hotel are clean and the housekeeping service is excellent! At this point, me and my colleague want to sincerely thank Trina Cooper at the counter for her courtesy and both professional and prompt help in all matters at all times. Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MoetChandonTyler
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was rennovated three years ago and the interior styling is lovely. The color scheme is a wonderful mixture of blues and yellows. The beds are great. It is very clean and the service was excellent. Gerardo went above and beyond to assist me. The bartender makes a good margarita. Use the valet parking. It is easiest.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was the most welcoming and pleasant place to stay at!!!”
Reviews.Author: Abbey A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for an entire week with 4 of my other colleagues for a hampton conference downtown. I am from Cleveland, OH and have never been to Texas before, this entire stay blew me away with the outstanding customer service. I asked a lot of questions about the area and were to eat and have some fun and the shuttle drivers especially (Larry and his name started with an R, but i cannot remember it. They knew everything about the area and were really informative about everything. The rooms were great, loved the colors, very clean. The food as very good, also the restaurant stay was excellent as well. I am a manager of a hotel as well and it takes a lot to impress me. Great job, I will definitely recommended this hotel, keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “What a great "happy" place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ranjmc
Reviews.Content: From my first interaction with the valet personnel upon arrival throughout my entire stay, all of the staff were extraordinarily proficient, friendly, and exhibited a positive attitude. At the front desk, "Gerardo's" customer service skills are beyond compare. His professional expertise is demonstrated in his interactions with customers and other staff members!! The hotel has a very warm welcoming feeling, my room was spotless with a nice modern "happy feeling" dÃ©cor. Can't wait to return for another stay!

Reviews.Title: “What an odd place, you walk in and feel...”
Reviews.Author: matt_from_nottingham
Reviews.Content: What an odd place, you walk in and feel immediately transported to an 80s seaside resort not downtown Dallas? A very cramped room by US standards and old and outdated decor. Bathroom in poor condition, shower falling off wall, but functional and clean. Biggest shock of the night was hotel bar closure at 9:55! Yes went for a drink and was greeted by the barman mopping the floor. Thankfully there are other bars in the area to get a drink in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff & Service”
Reviews.Author: ohioTraveler010
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked in the door of this hotel we were treated like family! From Nina and Gerardo at the front desk to each and every one of the restaurant and Bell Staff Franklin, Greg, Ruben, Larry, Bobby, Walter and everyone else I didn't mention by name THANK YOU for making us feel at home! It was out first trip to Dallas or Texas for that matter and everyone at this hotel was friendly, welcoming, and over the top accommodating. By far one the best hotels I have stayed at, their customer service reigns supreme! Glad to see this hotel is ranks #1 on this site! It is all about the staff on this one! Thank you and Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “Will book it for our next stay in Dallas...!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hooksett_NHIke
Reviews.Content: Service, service, service... all the way. They had a local FREE shuttle that saved us a ton on cab or car rental. We were at the hotel for a week and used the shuttle 2-3 times a day on advarage.. had all the conforts of home.. It even had a laundry.. It was the original hotel of Mr. "Hilton" and is on the national regester..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo service was awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: CincyKid20
Reviews.Content: The service you receive at Hotel Indigo is excellent. Reuben & Larry were outstanding valet parkers and shuttle drivers. They were always very courtous and very friendly. We really enjoyed talking with them about Dallas as this was our first trip to Dallas. They gave excellent food recommendations each night. Devon was a very pleasant bartender & server at the hotel resturant. We really enjoyed our stay and we would come back & stay at this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Professional Customer Service at a Moderate Price”
Reviews.Author: wlljayman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Indigo for 10 weeks in 2008 and I am currently staying for 12 weeks this year. I have came back and will continue to come back to the Indigo because of the exceptional customer service of the hotel staff. Everyone at the Hotel is friendly. When I walk through the front door I am called by name and I feel like I am staying with family. From the front desk (Dora, Trina, Gerardo, Nina) to the bar (Ben and Devon) to curbside ( Michael, Larry, Franklin, Reuben, and Greg) you are treated as though they truly appreciate your business. To them, it seems to be more than a job. It's something they take pride in. I have in the past and will continue to recommend this hotel to my friends, family and colleagues.... Jason W.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: kakLittleRock_Ar
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Indigo! A bellman met me on the street and cheerfully took my bags inside. Although there were several guests checking in at the same time I arrived, a staff member immediately greeted me and started my check-in before I even got to the desk. In fact, the general manager was in the lobby and greeted me too! They told me that my room would be across from the elevator and asked me if that was OK. I was concerned about noise, but I thought I'd give it a shot. THere was absolutely no problem. The room was great! CLEAN, good linens, comfy bed, nice bathroom- couldn't ask for more. We also had delicious breakfasts delivered to the room at a very reasonable price. I was sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, delicious food, comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: HenrySmithson
Reviews.Content: The first Hilton Hotel built by Conrad in the 1920s, a historic, iconic building -- old, but very well maintained and brought up-to-date with Indigo brand charm (blue murals and Haiku poems everywhere). Staff was uniformly courteous and helpful. Room was very clean and comfortable, small and cozy. Wireless internet worked well. Restaurant staff was friendly, helpful, and the food was delicious. Downtown Dallas doesn't have much to recommend it, unless you want to see the museum that displays the site of President Kennedy's assassination. But if you are a business traveler and are looking for something a bit different and charming, the Indigo is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and convienent!”
Reviews.Author: cwsprecious
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel at least once or twice a month for business. The rooms are clean. The staff are friendly and are very accomodating to my needs. They also have a shuttle that will take you to nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lilly_Fox
Reviews.Content: We had a group of seven women attending the Dallas Market and stayed in two rooms. The rooms were spacious and we were all very comfortable. The rooms aren't your standard "cookie cutter" rooms and had Aveda bath products. The beds were VERY comfortable! The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Our shuttle driver from the Market Center didn't know where he was going and somebody had to get out their IPhone to show him how to get there. When we got to the hotel, the front desk staff was extremely appologetic and bought us drinks in the lounge. Throughout the weekend, the staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable. The shuttle provided transportation to and from different locations throughout downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo honors family members of the fallen during Snowball Express”
Reviews.Author: SnowballExpress2009
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Indigo Dec. 9-13, 2009, with a group called Snowball Express. Snowball Express 2009 consisted of 1,300 children of fallen military members and their remaining parent or guardian. Absolutely every member of the Indigo's staff treated, not only my family, but all the other families with the utmost honor and respect. While the group was always involved in a whirlwind of activity, the hotel's staff was always ready and waiting to do whatever they could to accomodate our needs and wants. The rooms are beautiful, clean and very well stocked. The beds and pillows are phenomenal. Staff members are always pleasant and anxious to please. (They actually allowed me to 'steal' buy a pillow to take home because I loved it so much.) I highly recommend Hotel Indigo and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I would NOT suggest this hotel to anybody.”
Reviews.Author: Mstangbroncos142
Reviews.Content: First, When we check in and get to our room we find they have made an error in booking our room. We requested a suite, we received a single person room for a family of four.. The hotel staff did nothing to fix this problem. Next, the pull out sofa bed is absolutely terrible, if they would have got our arrangements correct this wouldn't had been an issue. they didn't supply the pull out bed with pillows or a comforter. We asked a gentlemen in the main lobby and he says "whats in the room is what you get." This was rather rude for a supposedly "upscale" hotel. Following this further, hopefully your not hungry seeing as how they don't have snack machines at all. Also, our room lacked basic amenities, such as a microwave and a dresser with drawers to put our clothes.This hotel is terrible and does NOT give you the basic amenities even after paying $350 a night. Try a different hotel and save yourself the headache.

Reviews.Title: “How Fun!”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYPLACES1962
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the Superpages.com Center in order to attend Crue Fest 2. We stayed only one night, were upgraded to a suite at no extra charge and thouroughly enjoyed the hotel. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The free shuttle service to the concert venue certainly did not hurt. The room was extremely clean and comfortable. A/C worked properly and the room had everything advertised. Surprisingly, the pictures on their web site were very accurate. Loved the hotel, loved the staff, would definitely stay there again if the occassion called for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: koppk01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while in Dallas/ Fort Worth. /found the hotel to be very convenient and clean with a friendly staff. Room was nice and roomy with a contemporary art deco feel to it. It is conveniently located to the West end and Dealey Plaza museum.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo is my new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quill78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Indigo in Dallas on July 18-19, 2009. We were thoroughly delighted with the experience. The hotel staff greeted us courteously as soon as we walked in the door. The hotel decor is bright and eclectic. We loved the murals and bright colors. Our room, on the 13th floor, was very comfortable. Though it wasn't the largest hotel room we've ever stayed in, it worked out great for us. Nice hardwood floors, flat screen tv and a super comfortable bed made the room special. We also enjoyed the little haiku poems we found on everything, such as hotel stationery. The hotel is conveniently located downtown, well within walking distance of Dealey Plaza and several museums, plus lots of shopping, restaurants and bars. The hotel also provided a free shuttle service to anywhere in the downtown area. This was greatly appreciated! We were in town to attend the Aerosmith concert, and the hotel shuttle dropped us off at the concert, as well as the Deep Ellum area. We also enjoyed a fun discussion one evening about possible paranormal activity in the hotel with the hotel bartender. Probably the only criticism we would have about this hotel was that beers in the bar cost $6, which we found a little high. Hotel Indigo is moderately priced, compared to other downtown hotels. We would definitely recommend Hotel Indigo to our friends, and will try to return to this hotel and seek out other Hotel Indigo locations.

Reviews.Title: “Close it”
Reviews.Author: zekeCharleston
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week in October- scuzzy area but that may have been due to some construction across the street. Service was barely passable, rooms are small, amenities are at a low level. Had a billing dispute that the hotel couldn't care less about. Life is to short to subject yourself to this kind of shoddy place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but the walls are thin...”
Reviews.Author: ClaesBraque
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel, as its aesthetics are a nice departure from the usual drab hotel decor. It is bright and cheery, yet tastefully modern. And clean! The beds are VERY comfortable, and the complimentary Aveda products were a plus. The fitness room is small, but everything was new. Our only complaint is that the walls are thin; we were able to hear every word our neighbors uttered at 2 AM in the next room. This is a great place if you can get it for $100 or less. Also, we recommend trying the Italian restaurant (Porta Roma, I believe) down the street. They have AWESOME pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, great coffee!”
Reviews.Author: one_of_the_octuplets
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 2 friends over the President's Day weekend. Didn't think much of Dallas overall but this hotel was great for the price. The rooms are very comfortable. The beachy decor is a little odd - I kinda felt like I was staying on Cape Cod rather than downtown Dallas but it's not offensive to the eye or anything and it grows on you the longer you stay :) Microwave and fridge in the room. Awesome shower! The beds face each other which is a new one for me. Not a problem except the TV was to the left between those 2 beds so if you are planning on staying in the room and watching TV from bed then this probably isn't the place for you unless you like having neck strain! But then again if you wanted to do that, you could just stay home! Loved the fact that there was a restaurant downstairs with reasonably priced food that served Starbuck's coffee. I would recommend the fruit trio. Avoid the eggs, not that great but my friend recommends the pancakes. The room service menu looked good and prices were cheap compared to other hotels I've stayed in but didn't get a chance to try it out unfortunately. Also highly recommended by my 2 friends is the Stirling merlot in the hotel bar. For those who need parking, there is a garage directly across from the main entrance. It costs about $5 in/out (or $10 depending on the cashier's mood!) and it was never even close to being full when we stayed. Staff at the Indigo were very helpful and friendly during our stay even mailing postcards at no cost for my friend when we were checking out. For a three star hotel in downtown Dallas, this is a really great option.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool and would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Dinrbear
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, clean and different. Not your run of the mill or cookie cutter kind of place. It was trying to be the W, but on a budget. Kind of reminded me of my stay in Amsterdam...very euro. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The location great if going to American Airlines Center and they will shuttle you. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Horrible Horrible”
Reviews.Author: ANS07
Reviews.Content: We rented four rooms at the Dallas Indigo for a weekend in October. Our experience was so horrible that I feel the need to say something so others know what to expect. They told us that we would each have a fridge when we got there only two rooms were as we were told. When we called downstairs to ask we were met with an extremely rude front desk person who threatened us with the police for asking about fridge. The doors have a gap at the bottom that allows you to her everything in the hallway. We will never go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: roydio
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the colors and ambiance of this hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful, everyone greeted us cheerfully daily. We are here for 8 days doing a trade show, so the beds were a treat after a grueling long days. The complimentary hotel shuttle is a great advantage when you don't have a car and the drivers are very accomodating and go an extra mile to bring you to local restaurants/areas and pickup is fast. Internet is very good and free. The manager, Trey Harold, was extra helpful and went the extra mile to help us print important material for our show. We highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average But Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: KingLeonidas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo was great for my two day business trip. It was reasonable for the price of other hotel hotels in the downtown area. I arrived late the fist night so I had to dine via room service. The food was good though they try to make it fancy when all you want is something simple late at night. All of the staff was great and provided outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: konna123
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Indigo in downtown Dallas. The beds were very comfortable. Nice decor, also. Lawrence the bellman was great. Would def. stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaSooner
Reviews.Content: Great rooms. Very nice lobby. Not a great neighborhood but not horrible. There are restaurants within walking distance. The hotel restaurant/bar doesn't open until 4:30. Our room was small but the bed was very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thirteen20WRX
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights this February. Booked online and got a GREAT government rate (<$100/night). Hotel was absolutely gorgeous, service was great, and the location was fantastic. The restaurant in the lobby was pricey but delicious. Upon checkout, I realized that someone had charged about $50 worth of food/drink to my room account. The front desk attendant was skeptical but helpful--she removed the charges from my account but notified me that if a receipt with my signature was found, the charges would be placed back on my credit card. All in all I enjoyed my stay very much and plan on staying here whenever I return to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsDawg
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but were more than pleasantly surprised by this wonderful hotel. Service was exceptional. We arrived at 10 a.m. with the intent of dropping off our luggage until we could check in later. (The bellman had already warned us the hotel was full). However, the front desk clerk found us a room - and what a room. Two room suite with king bedroom, plus a separate living room with confortable sofa and chair. Bright, cheery colors, super clean, small refrigerator, charming bath - just perfect. Room service was prompt (they accomodated us even though it was outside their normal hours of service) and food delicious. We went downstairs later for dessert and found and even more tantilizing menu. Definitely eat here - food is superb! I can't say enough about this hotel -it was the first Hilton Hotel ever and this newest rendition has to be one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: aalex1111
Reviews.Content: American Airlines flew us into Dallas just as a stormed peaked and the airport was shutdown for the night. All of the hotels were booked except the "Indigo" in downtown Dallas. I expected the worst. Upon arrival, I was very pleased to see this recently remodeled hotel that carefully handled all of the grumpy travelers and put us up for the night. The room was great!! Flat screen TV, plenty of towels, fabulous sitting room area and a very comfortable bed. This hotel is highly recommended, even when not blown into town by a storm. Congrats to the owner and manager of this fine establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Indigo - bright botique room”
Reviews.Author: lauramly
Reviews.Content: I called their 800 reservation line and they had a two queen room for $129. I wanted a King, but the guy on the phone said none were available. Checked out their website, and was able to get a King nonsmoking for same price. I had a horrible flight. A 45 minute hopper turned into a 4 hour mess with a unscheduled 2 hour stop in amarillo. So by the time 11PM rolled around, i was very happy to be in the hotel. When I got the into the room, I was very pleasantly surprised. The room was bright. Spring Iris backdropped the room. It was small, but had everything I needed. Included tea for the Senseo-like coffee machine. Love the Aveno products, too. Very clean, very comfortable. Will definitely stay again if I ever have business in Downtown Dallas. The shuttle driver was a bit...rude. But glad for the shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: PlayfulPlatypus
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a conference over at the Adams Mark Hotel. This hotel is a good two blocks away but a world away in service and room amenties. Hot water was always available, no matter what time of day or night. The internet worked every time I tried to log on. The business center with two computers was available when I needed to print something. There was not an extra charge for using the printer nor the internet. The room was crammed with furniture but it was nice to have a sofa and a chair to sit on instead of only the bed. The decor was bright and cheery. The bed was perfect and the blanket was encased in sheets. The shower had a choice in spray type--hard, pulsing, or gentle. The staff was super friendly. I flew in early for the conference and dropped off my luggage at Hotel Indigo without a hitch. The East downtown transfer station is only one block away if you want to take the bus anywhere. I took the local bus from the airport to the hotel door for only $1.25. It sure beat waiting for the Super Shuttle to come or riding the van around and around the airport waiting on more customers before it left for downtown Dallas. Downside: I walked the two blocks from the Adams Mark to this hotel every time I wanted to go back to my room for something. The shuttle was available if I needed it which I did when I got caught in a downpour. There is only one restaurant in close proxiity for breakfast. At night, you need to take the bus or tram down to the West End to find food. Most everything closes at 3pm in this area for food. Make sure that you bring your walking shoes if you are going to attend a conference over at the Adams Mark. The distance from rooms to conference to food or bar is huge. Some people in my group had problems getting around because of their fitness level.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Indigo Dallas Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1933 Main St., Dallas, TX 75201
